meanings.definition: An amount or quantity greater than is necessary, desirable, or acceptable.
meanings.sent1: She always buys in excesses, ending up with more than she needs.
meanings.sent2: The store had to discount the excesses of stock to make room for new items.
meanings.sent3: His love for ice cream knows no bounds, leading to excesses of dessert every night.
meanings.sent4: The overflowing river symbolized the excesses of nature's power after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The excesses of sugar in the cake made it too sweet to eat.

meanings.definition: The state of exceeding what is normal or sufficient.
meanings.sent1: The excesses of noise from the party kept the neighbors awake all night.
meanings.sent2: The company's success led to financial excesses that needed to be reined in.
meanings.sent3: The excesses of laughter in the comedy show had everyone in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The excesses of joy on her face were evident when she received the surprise gift.
meanings.sent5: The excesses of enthusiasm in his speech captivated the audience.

meanings.sent1: After the holiday feast, the family felt the effects of their excesses.
meanings.sent2: His doctor warned him about the health risks of his dietary excesses.
meanings.sent3: The excesses of the buffet tempted him to try every dish available.
meanings.sent4: Her regret over the excesses of last night's party lingered the next morning.
meanings.sent5: The excesses of alcohol at the celebration led to some embarrassing moments.
